verbose_text: In contrast, pre-treatment of hearts with clonidine, which stimulates alpha 2 -adrenergic receptor and decreases cellular cAMP level, was ineffective at preventing isoproterenol mediated Mg 2+ extrusion (data not shown), in keeping with the limited representation of these receptors within the cardiac tissue [XREF_BIBR] Data in the literature indicate that beta-adrenergic stimulation induces Mg 2+ extrusion via cAMP dependent activation (phosphorylation) of the Na + / Mg 2+ exchanger [XREF_BIBR, XREF_BIBR, XREF_BIBR], a process that can be inhibited by the administration of Rp-cAMP [XREF_BIBR], or amiloride [XREF_BIBR, XREF_BIBR], which block adenylyl cyclase and the Na + / Mg 2+ exchanger, respectively.
